br.fml.eti.machinegun.externaltools
Interface PersistedQueueManager

public interface PersistedQueueManager

It is recommended to implement this interface using a JMS implementation, like the HornetQ, e.g. 


                       |
                   \  |  /
                    \_|_/
                  .'     '.
                 / _    _  \
                | / `  / `  |
                | \_0  \_0  |
            _  _ \  .---.  /
      ___/\/ \/ \_'/     \'____________
      \  \/\_/\_/  \     /            /
       )            '---'            (
      /           YOUR QUEUE          \
      \        IMPLEMENTATION         /
       )            HERE!      _  _  (
      /jgs__________________/\/ \/ \__\
                  |   |   | \/\_/\_/
                  |_  |  _|
                  |   |   |
                  |___|___|
                  /--'Y'--\
                 (___/ \___)

Method Detail

putIntoAnEmbeddedQueue

void putIntoAnEmbeddedQueue(ArmyAudit armyAudit,
                            java.lang.String queueName,
                            byte[] data)
                            throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Put a data into a queue. Options of retries, logs and exceptions handling must be done externally by the specific implementation. This function assumes the action will never crash: because it, depending of implementation, this function could do nothing. If you want to take more control over it, you are able to use the ArmyAudit to intercept some error; but it will work fine only if the specific implementation gossips what its does to the auditor. Please read carefully the specific implementation documentation!

Parameters:
armyAudit - If something went wrong, you can know monitoring with this.
queueName - The embedded queue name related with the specific type of data.
data - The data to be put in the queue.
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - Because it can be asynchronous, it may throw this.
See Also:
ArmyAudit.errorWhenPuttingIntoAnEmbeddedQueue(java.lang.Exception)

registerANewConsumerInAnEmbeddedQueue

void registerANewConsumerInAnEmbeddedQueue(ArmyAudit armyAudit,
                                           java.lang.String queueName,
                                           Consumer consumer)
Prepare a new consumer to work on the new elements in the specified queue. Options of retries, logs and exceptions handling must be done externally by the specific implementation. This function assumes the action will never crash: because it, depending of implementation, this function could do nothing. If you want take more control over it, you are able to use the ArmyAudit to intercept some error; but it will work fine only if the specific implementation gossips what its does to the auditor. Please read carefully the specific implementation documentation!

Parameters:
armyAudit - If something went wrong you can know monitoring with this.
queueName - The embedded queue name related with the specific type of data.
consumer - The action to do when some element is available to consume.
See Also:
ArmyAudit.errorWhenRegisteringANewConsumerInAnEmbeddedQueue(java.lang.Exception)

killAllConsumers

void killAllConsumers(java.lang.String queueName)
                      throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Kill all consumers of a specific queue.

Parameters:
queueName - The queue name.
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - Because it may be asynchronous.
